title: Who's going to attend ATypI Lisbon?
content:
[In case there is no such thread already.]

Who will be there?
author: k.l.

comments.content: I'll be there. :^)
Mi 2 :^D
I
Ditto

MS is sending Kevin Larson (ClearType team researcher), Sergey Malkin (VOLT and OpenType Layout engineer) and Andrei Burago (Office Math font guru) - be sure to catch them if you have interest in these areas.

Cheers, Si
I'm there, too.
Shu, Yves, Jim Greishaber, and myself will be in a hotel down the street (with a pool on the roof). I think you can guess where the party is at.
This time I agree with Stephen about where the party is at. He was so wrong last time.
TypeTech forum + ATypI conference

<cite> TypeTech forum + ATypI conference </cite>

same here
Party ;)

Simon, why aren't they sending you?!  
When's the last time you missed an ATypI conference?

hhp

Me too,  
Stephen, is Yves rooming with us?  
Or are you just in the same hotel, Yves?  
See you there!

\>Simon, why aren’t they sending you?!

It was a bit too close to the baby's due date. I'm definitely sad to be missing the country delegates meetings, but I'll be at next years conference (if the rumors re. venue can be believed it will be a good one) and will be bringing the family with me.

\>When’s the last time you missed an ATypI conference?

Rome :-(

\> It was a bit too close to the baby’s due date.

I once missed a TypeCon for a comparable reason!

\> if the rumors re. venue can be believed it will be a good one

I hope they are true, for my sake... :-\>

\> Rome :-(

Oh - yeah, you weren't there were you. That's the last ATypI that I went to. The food was good, as I'm sure you heard. Actually, a lot of the content was good too. On the other hand after Leipzig's content anything would have seemed good... But the city made up for it in such a big way - I've never had such huge blisters from walking.

hhp

**I'll be staying at _Pensão Residencia Roma_, close to Restauradores Square. I don't know if there's a pool on the roof (it suddenly felt like The Thing To Crave). Hope there's a sauna though.**

See You soon!

ƒ

Sadly I won't be attending this year.  
Sadly for me, that is. YOU'll have fun. ;-)  
I was in Lisbon on a Linotype partner conference once... lovely city...

Miguel has the longest comute ;-P

ChrisL

Fredo,  
Tag, you are it :-)

ChrisL

Yup. I hope last year's experience didn't put you off. :^P

Good excuse -- maybe a little <cite>too</cite> young for travelling and following lectures ... :)

Cheers, Si

Not the longest, but still quite long. I'm arriving from Reading, UK ;^P

\> _I cannot await walking through the city (until feet hurt)._

Good to hear that! BTW, did you know that [Lisbon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Lisbon) was built on 7 hills\*? You can get very nice views of the city from several scenic lookouts.

-- [Lisboa, o Castelo e o Tejo (Tagus river)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/www.pbase.com/diasdosreis/image/66680038)  
-- [View of the bridge from Castelo (castle)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/www.pbase.com/diasdosreis/image/30816424)  
-- [Lisbon Downtown seen from the castle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/www.pbase.com/diasdosreis/image/58589239)  
-- From São Pedro de Alcântara scenic lookout: [Daytime](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/www.pbase.com/diasdosreis/image/17307307) and [Nighttime](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/www.pbase.com/diasdosreis/image/23789397).  
-- [From Santa Justa elevator](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/www.pbase.com/diasdosreis/image/24113953)

\* Castelo, Graça, Monte, Santa Catarina, Penha de França, S. Pedro de Alcântara and Estrela

BTW, don't forget to stop by and have a coffee/tea with [Fernando Pessoa](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017202938/http:/www.pbase.com/diasdosreis/image/58888333). (This place is right by the conference venue)
